description.en: In the beginning of the course students can select a topic which they start to solve in a smaller group. Every group has a supervisor. Course is based on a problem based learning method. Additionally lectures about various remote sensing applications will be held.
description.et: Kursuse põhirõhk on rühmatööl, mille käigus üliõpilased saavad valida püstitatud probleemülesannete seast huvipakkuvaima ning hakkavad seda rühmasiseselt lahendama. Igal rühmal on juhendaja. Kursus toimub probleemipõhise õppe protsessina. Lisaks toimuvad loengud.

objectives.en: Course will focus on various methods and applications used in remote sensing of environment. Overview will be given about passive and active remote sensing. Students will learn how to combine data from various origin and sources to analyse the changes in environment.
objectives.et: Ainekursus annab põhjalikud teadmised aktiivse ja passiivse kaugseire vahenditest ja meetoditest. Kursuse kuulaja omandab satelliidipiltide töötlemise ja analüüsi võtted. Õpitake kombineerima andmeid erinevatest andmebaasidest ning looma sünergiat erinevate andmetüüpide vahel.

learning_outcomes.en: After the end of the course:
- students have the overview about principles used in passive, radar and lidar remote sensing and their respective application fields;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab üliõpilane passiivse, radar-, lidarkaugseire põhimõtteid ja erinevaid rakendusvaldkondi;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the principles of spectral measurements (knows the terms spectrometer, radiance, irradiance, reflectance, atmospheric correction, calibration),
learning_outcomes.et: - on saanud ülevaate spektraalmõõtmistest (teab mõisteid: spektromeeter, kirkus, kiiritustihedus, peegeldustegur, atmosfäärikorrektsioon, kalibratsioon);

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the principles in water remote sensing (bio-optical modelling, adjacency effect)
- knows the principles in vegetation remote sensing (optical properties of the leaf, contribution of various features to the reflectance, leaf angles, various indices).
learning_outcomes.et: - teab taimkatte kaugseire iseärasusi (taimelehe optilised omadused, peegeldusteguri komponendid, lehtede kaldenurgad, erinevad indeksid).

learning_outcomes.en: - student knows how to download, process and analyse remote sensing and possibly ancillary data and apply this knowledge to solve various exercises.
learning_outcomes.et: - leida, töödelda ja kasutada kaugseire ja vajadusel lisaandmeid, ning rakendada neid teadmisi erinevate looduskeskkonda iselmoomustavate näitajate hindamise, ajalis-ruumiliste muustuste tuvastamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: - understands the differences in remote sensing and field data, how to combine them and use for spatio-temporal analyses and supporting the sustainable development goals (SDG) and international environmental frameworks.
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab kaugseire ja kontaktmõõtmiste käigus kogutud andmete erinevusi, oskab neid kombineerida ja kasutada ajalis-ruumilisteks analüüsideks ning toetamaks säästva arengu eesmärke (SDG) ja keskkonnapoliitika direktiive.

learning_outcomes.en: - have gained experience how to plan and conduct groupwork, share responsibilities inside small group, present results.
learning_outcomes.et: -oskab planeerida ning läbi viia rühmatööd, jaotada ülesandeid rühmaliikmete vahel ning raporteerida tulemusi.

independent_work.et:
The majority of the course is based on the problem-learning method. In the first lecture, various environmental related topics will be introduced to the students from which they can select the topic of their interest and form groups. Each group has a supervisor who will be available for consultations and monitoring the progress throughout the course.

There will be weekly meetings with overview lectures on different remote sensing related topics. Each week a group has to provide an update on their progress from the last meeting and their plans for the coming week at the meeting. Short reports (max one A4 sheet) have to be sent to the group supervisor weekly.

In the end of the course, the final group project report has to be sent to the supervisor and the results have to be presented to the audience.

In the last week, there will be an exam covering the content of presented lectures during the course.

grade_preconditions.et: Student has weekly contributed to the group work.

grade_evaluation.et: Final mark will be derived based on the input to the weekly progress reports, final written report, oral presentation and exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
